official-title.#text:
To clarify the application of certain leverage and risk-based requirements under the Dodd-Frank
			 Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act.

sponsor.#text: Mr. Gary G. Miller of California

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Insurance Capital Standards Clarification Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Insurance Capital Standards Clarification Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 171 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:171

header.#text: Clarification of application of leverage and risk-based capital requirements

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , by adding at the end the following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:171/ss:a
Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:1002/p:3

term.#tail: has the same meaning as in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:1002/p:22

term.#tail: has the same meaning as in
term.#text: person regulated by a State insurance regulator

header.#text: Person regulated by a state insurance regulator
Regulated foreign subsidiary and regulated foreign affiliate

quote.#tail:
mean a person engaged in the business of insurance in a foreign country that is regulated by a
			 foreign insurance regulatory authority that is a member of the
			 International Association of Insurance Supervisors or other comparable
			 foreign insurance regulatory authority as determined by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
following consultation with the State insurance regulators,
			 including the lead State insurance commissioner (or similar State
			 official) of the insurance holding company system as determined by the
			 procedures within the Financial Analysis Handbook adopted by the National
			 Association of Insurance Commissioners, where the person, or its principal
			 United States insurance affiliate, has its principal place of business or
			 is domiciled, but only to the extent that—

text.#text: such person acts in its capacity as a regulated insurance entity; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
does not determine that the capital requirements in a specific foreign
			 jurisdiction are inadequate.

header.#text: Capacity as a regulated insurance entity

term.#text: capacity as a regulated insurance entity

text.#text:
includes any action or activity undertaken by a person regulated by a State insurance regulator or
			 a regulated foreign subsidiary or regulated foreign affiliate of such
			 person, as those actions relate to the provision of insurance, or other
			 activities necessary to engage in the business of insurance; and

does not include any action or activity, including any financial activity, that is not regulated by
			 a State insurance regulator or a foreign agency or authority and subject
			 to State insurance capital requirements or, in the case of a regulated
			 foreign subsidiary or regulated foreign affiliate, capital requirements
			 imposed by a foreign insurance regulatory authority.
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:171/ss:b/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the
			 appropriate Federal banking agencies shall not be required to include, for
			 any purpose of this section (including in any determination of
			 consolidation), a person regulated by a State insurance regulator or a
			 regulated foreign subsidiary or a regulated foreign affiliate of such
			 person engaged in the business of insurance, to the extent that such
			 person acts in its capacity as a regulated insurance entity.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act/s:171/ss:b/p:2

text.#text:
In establishing the minimum leverage capital requirements and minimum risk-based capital
			 requirements on a consolidated basis for a depository institution holding
			 company or a nonbank financial company supervised by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
authority to
			 issue regulations and orders relating to capital requirements for
			 depository institution holding companies or nonbank financial companies
			 supervised by the

text.#text:
This subsection shall not be construed to prohibit, modify, limit, or otherwise supersede any other
			 provision of Federal law that provides the

header.#text: Rule of construction on board’s authority

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that is also a person regulated by a State insurance regulator or
			 a regulated foreign subsidiary or a regulated foreign affiliate of such
			 person that files its holding company financial statements utilizing only
			 Statutory Accounting Principles in accordance with State law, shall not be
			 required to prepare such financial statements in accordance with Generally
			 Accepted Accounting Principles.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Board of Governors of the Federal
			 Reserve

text.#text:
Notwithstanding any other provision of law, a depository institution holding company or nonbank
			 financial company supervised by the

header.#text: Rule of construction on accounting principles
